messages.title: Dear
messages.content: I'm sure you'd agree with me that the NHS is a service that everyone who lives in Portsmouth really cares about. [...] But I'm really concerned about what will happen to the NHS if the Conservatives win.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to giving the NHS the funding it needs for the future. Will increase the NHS budget by £8 billion a year to support doctors and nurses, and help them continue doing their jobs brilliantly.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The electoral choice on 7th May is critical for preserving essential services such as the NHS.

issues.economy: We need to finish the job of fixing the economy so we can give the NHS the money it needs.
issues.health: Pleased that the Liberal Democrats have committed to funding the NHS. Concerned about privatization and proper funding if Conservatives win. Vital to fight for funding to give our NHS world class service.

leaflet.personalStatement: As the Liberal Democrat candidate for Portsmouth South, I will fight for vital funding for the NHS, and resist the extra bit that the Conservatives want to cut from the health service.

images.caption: A series of photos showing Gerald Vernon-Jackson engaging with the community and discussing issues.

leaflet.additionalNotes: PS. The choice in this election is between myself, who will fight for vital funding for the NHS, and the Conservatives who just want more cuts to the health service.
